tool_description: Encode videos in the cloud and host them with Flowplayer. Manage your video library, and access your videos' analytics data.
name: Flowplayer Drive
title: Flowplayer Drive

api_list.name: /videos
api_list.description: List all videos in the library
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://anssi-flowplayer-drive-v1.p.rapidapi.com/videos"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "anssi-flowplayer-drive-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: show video
api_list.description: Shows the specified video, with embedded encodings

import requests

            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",

api_list.name: traffic
api_list.description: Get traffic statistics for the specified video.

optional_parameters.name: start
optional_parameters.description: Optional start value of the time range. Format yyyy-mm-dd, for example 2013-01-01. Default value is dependent on the specified grouping.

optional_parameters.name: end
optional_parameters.description: Optional end value of the time range. Format yyyy-mm-dd. Defaults to yesterday.

optional_parameters.name: grouping
optional_parameters.description: One of 'hour', 'day', 'week', 'month'. Specifies the granularity of the results. For example, in a day grouping one value is returned for each day of the time range. In a hour grouping one value is returned for every hour.

optional_parameters.name: type
optional_parameters.description: Either 'views' or 'bytes'. Specifies if the results should be view counts or bytes. Defaults to 'views'.

api_list.name: retention
api_list.description: Get retention data for the specified video. Retention data answers following questions: How long do viewers spend watching your videos? At what point do they lose interest or tune out and go elsewhere? The returned data tells the percentage (and count) of viewers that watched the video up to a given time in the video's timeline.
